pageContext.claim: “My father was in great shape well into his 80s mentally.”
pageContext.analysis: This is in dispute, and the subject of a family drama. Trump attempted to change his father's will in the early 1990s, when Fred Trump Sr. was in his 80s and in the early stages of dementia, according to other family members. Trump’s sister Maryanne Trump Barry was recorded by her niece in January 2019 expressing outrage over her brother’s efforts to change the will as their father’s mental capacity was declining. “Dad was in dementia,” Barry said, as reported by The Washington Post's Michael Kranish.
